comment:
Firstly, at around 115 proof, it's incredibly smooth, not much ethanol on the nose or palate.

The smoke is very present on the nose and palate, think a very intense camp fire, no brine at all.  After it subsides it openes to a lovely dark fruit sweetness. 

Overall I really enjoyed this, a little more ageing could have gone a long way, as smoke can be a bit spikey.  Great whisky even if it's a little unbalanced, B+

Another freebie pre old and rare tasting. Really nice dram, was up to 4.25 no water until i compared it to the old and rare selection. For the price still deserves the rating but overall tasted a lot younger and ethanolly in comparison. 3.75 to 4
Just opened today 1/21/2020 and will give another review after the neck pour is gone and letting some weeks for the bottle to open up.
Brine up front and long smoky finish.
Delicious smoke & fruity sweetness. Lingering finish of sherry baking spices and herbal European oak
